alert.note: Alert for Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley; Western Siskiyou National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 09 at 1:25PM PDT until September 10 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .Gusty winds combined with low humidities will bring critical conditions to portions of fire zones 618, 619, 620 and 280 into this evening. These same areas, except for fire zone 618, will also experience gusty winds and poor overnight recoveries, especially near and at the ridges overnight tonight into Saturday morning. Meanwhile, low humidities and gusty east winds will continue over and near the Southern Oregon Cascades, Siskiyous, and most of the westside, including the coastal mountains, into Saturday evening. Additionally, strong winds and low humidities are likely Saturday afternoon into Saturday evening in the Shasta Valley and the higher terrain in Fire zone 280, including the Mill and Mountain Fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH AND GUSTY WINDS AND POOR OVERNIGHT RECOVERIES AND AND HAINES 6... * IMPACTS: Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. * AFFECTED AREA: Most of Fire Zone 619 and much of the Illinois Valley and surrounding hills in fire zone 620, including the Rum Creek Fire. * WIND: East 10 to 20 mph with gusts to around 35 mph into Saturday morning, then shifting south Saturday afternoon. * HUMIDITY: Daytime Humidities 6 to 14 percent. Night time recoveries 15 to 24 percent. * DETAILED URL: View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr * ADDITIONAL DETAILS: A high level haines index of 6 is forecast this afternoon and Saturday afternoon in zone 620, including over the Rum Creek Fire. Haines 6 conditions along with hot and dry conditions will lead to significant potential for large fire growth.
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley; Western Siskiyou National Forest
